frame.name: Visiting_scenario_arrival
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> arrives at a location that should help them achieve their <fen>Purpose</fen>. This situation is point-of-view-neutral.</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Agent</fen> is the object that moves under its own power. </def-root>

FE.name: Normal_location
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Normal_location</fen> is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While <fen>Normal_location</fen> expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent. If present, they often express a general direction from which a <fen>Agent</fen> moves, rather than a landmark away from which it moves.</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Normal_location</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>. In this frame, <fen>Path</fen> expressions almost always have a via-sense.</def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Goal</fen> is any expression that tells where the <fen>Agent</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion. Although always conceptually present and specific, <fen>Goal</fen> may sometimes be understood from context, rather than expressed by any separate constituent.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Manner</fen> expression describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Agent</fen> arrives.</def-root>

FE.name: Mode_of_transportation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> expresses how the motion of the <fen>Agent</fen> is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the <fen>Agent</fen>. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when arriving occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Agent</fen> arrives at the <fen>Goal</fen>.</def-root>
